summary:
• Heavy rainfall caused widespread flooding in southern Brazil
• Thousands of people affected by the disaster
• Rescue efforts underway to reach stranded communities

• A precocious prime minister faces competition from a far-right phenom in France.
• The prime minister's ability to hold off the challenger is uncertain due to their differing political ideologies.
• The outcome will significantly impact French politics.

• Gang violence in Haiti resulted in the deaths of US missionaries.
• Three missionaries from an Oklahoma-based group were among those killed.
• The US is trying to downplay its involvement in Haiti despite its visible military presence.

• A politician's involvement in an astrologer's murder led to a significant legal change.
• A heartwarming story about Indian sisters was showcased at the Cannes Film Festival.
• No additional information is available regarding this headline as it appears to be a duplicate entry.

• Conflict escalates as Israeli activists clash over Gaza-bound aid convoys and three Israeli hostages are found dead in Gaza.
• Israel reverses its decision to shut down the Associated Press news agency's Gaza live feed.
• The number of remaining hostages in Gaza is unknown after a Hamas attack on Israel, while Israel urges negotiators to continue hostage talks and faces increasing international isolation.

• Kenyan police will deploy to Haiti within three weeks.
• The move aims to support local authorities in addressing security concerns.
• The deployment demonstrates regional solidarity and cooperation.

• A man discovered 30,000-year-old mammoth bones in his wine cellar.
• The ancient remains were found in Mexico.
• No further details about the discovery have been released.

• The International Court of Justice at The Hague has ordered Israel to halt its military operation in the Gaza Strip.
• The ruling comes after Egypt withdrew its forces from the area, allowing Israeli troops to advance further into the territory.
• The ICJ's decision is seen as a significant blow to Israel's efforts to maintain control over the region.

• A military coup occurred in Niger.
• Security forces have taken control of key government buildings.
• The current whereabouts of President Mahamadou Issoufou remain unknown.

• A devastating landslide has struck Papua New Guinea, trapping numerous villagers.
• Emergency responders are racing against time to reach the affected areas and rescue those in need.
• The situation remains critical as search and rescue efforts continue to unfold.

• Cynthia, who voted for Nelson Mandela, is now abandoning his successors.
• She had previously supported Mandela but has since changed her stance.
• This shift in opinion may be due to various reasons such as political ideology or personal beliefs.

• Four people died in a building collapse in Majorca.
• Locals protested against a Louis Vuitton fashion show in Barcelona.
• The event caused chaos.

• A United Nations expert warns that the world is ignoring the risk of genocide in Sudan.
• The situation remains volatile due to ongoing political instability, conflict, and human rights abuses.
• The international community must take immediate action to prevent a potential humanitarian crisis.

• Rishi Sunak and Keir Starmer are the top contenders for UK Prime Minister.
• Both candidates have unique strengths and weaknesses that will be crucial in their bid for leadership.
• Their political views and leadership styles will shape the future direction of the country.

• Alec Baldwin's request to dismiss Rust manslaughter charges is rejected.
• Families of the Uvalde shooting sue Meta, a video game developer, and a firearms manufacturer.
• A teenager is arrested after a violent incident at a UCLA Gaza protest.
